repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:  Non-visible/focusable windows are assigned a window number,
          whereas commands that use this window number skip over them.
Solution: Skip over non-visible/focusable windows when computing
          the window number, unless it is made the current window
          through the API in which case an identifiable window number
          is still useful. This also ensures it matches the window
          number of the window entered by `<winnr>wincmd w` since
          403fcacf.

Fix #34184

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -13346,7 +13346,8 @@ M.funcs = {
     desc = [=[
       The result is a Number, which is the number of the current
       window.  The top window has number 1.
-      Returns zero for a popup window.
+      Returns zero for a popup, hidden or non |focusable| window,

comment_data.body: Well we don't have popup windows right so it should just be removed?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -13346,7 +13346,8 @@ M.funcs = {
     desc = [=[
       The result is a Number, which is the number of the current
       window.  The top window has number 1.
-      Returns zero for a popup window.
+      Returns zero for a popup, hidden or non |focusable| window,

comment_data.body: Popup windows are just like non-focusable floating windows, so yes.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -13346,7 +13346,8 @@ M.funcs = {
     desc = [=[
       The result is a Number, which is the number of the current
       window.  The top window has number 1.
-      Returns zero for a popup window.
+      Returns zero for a popup, hidden or non |focusable| window,

comment_regular_data.body: I think this now serves as an appropriate follow-up to 403fcacf.

I guess the ~~autocmd~~ current window does need a window number for BWC.
Also probably need to adjust winnr counters in various other places...

Again not sure this is a good idea actually. Maybe just excluding from `winnr('$')` and `wincmd` commands is enough. Though this adjusted test here does seem less surprising:
```diff
         command('2wincmd w')
-        eq(3, fn.winnr())
+        eq({ 2, 1005 }, { fn.winnr(), api.nvim_get_current_win() })
```

I think it makes sense conceptually to exclude non-visible/focusable windows from the window numbers, as they are the `[count]` for window commands which they cannot be targeted by. But when such a window _is_ made the current window, not being able to identify it by a unique window number can be surprising.

I guess it could return 0 in that case, as it is documented to do for popup windows.

After thinking about this a bit, I think it's fine for them to have nr 0; unfocusable/hidden floats are _kinda_ similar to Vim's popups anyway. :innocent:

There was some chatter about having focusable be respected for splits too at some point; dunno if `winnr()` should continue to be unique for those or not, but that's for the future. 

That said, I like how `{nr}<C-W>w` matches `winnr()` again. :+1:

> There was some chatter about having focusable be respected for splits too at some point; dunno if winnr() should continue to be unique for those or not, but that's for the future.

Right. I'll add a `win_has_winnr()` helper function so it can be easily updated in the future.

A difference here is that unfocusable floating windows can still be set to the current window using Nvim API. The autocmd window (which is unfocusable) can also be the current window. This is tricky, as it's not clear what behavior plugins expect when the current window is unfocusable.

> Maybe worth not excluding such a float from winnr() if it happens to already be current? (That is, it has a unique nr, and is included in winnr('$'))

Could make sense and/or be useful. Does feel a little magic but wouldn't be too hard to document.

> Or maybe wincmd p should skip unfocusables anyway?

I would say so yes.
Side-note: should we define and document "popups" as "unfocusable windows"? https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/34207#discussion_r2112045760

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(eval): winnr('$') counts non-current hidden/unfocusable windows
